description: Wisconsin Breast Cancer (Original) dataset containing features computed from digitized images of fine needle aspirates (FNA) of breast masses. Features describe characteristics of cell nuclei present in the image. The task is to classify tumors as benign or malignant based on cytological characteristics.
creator: Dr. William H. Wolberg (University of Wisconsin)

feature_descriptions.Clump_Thickness: Assessment of the thickness of clumps of cells (1-10)
feature_descriptions.Cell_Size_Uniformity: Evaluation of whether cells are uniform in size (1-10)
feature_descriptions.Cell_Shape_Uniformity: Evaluation of whether cells are uniform in shape (1-10)
feature_descriptions.Marginal_Adhesion: How much cells on the outside of the epithelial tend to stick together (1-10)
feature_descriptions.Normal_Nucleoli: Small structures in nucleus where ribosomes are made (1-10)

feature_scale: All features are on a scale of 1-10, with 1 being closest to benign and 10 being most abnormal
use_case: Breast cancer diagnosis support system to assist medical professionals in distinguishing between benign and malignant breast tumors based on cell characteristics from FNA samples
clinical_context: Fine needle aspiration is a diagnostic procedure where a thin needle is inserted into an area of abnormal tissue to extract cells for examination
ethical_considerations: Dataset should be used to support, not replace, medical professionals' judgment. Care must be taken to avoid bias in deployment. Patient privacy must be maintained when using similar medical data.

citations.author: O. L. Mangasarian and W. H. Wolberg
citations.title: Cancer diagnosis via linear programming

citations.author: William H. Wolberg and O.L. Mangasarian
citations.title: Multisurface method of pattern separation for medical diagnosis applied to breast cytology
citations.venue: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences

note: This is the 'Original' Wisconsin Breast Cancer dataset. There is also a related 'Diagnostic' (WDBC) dataset with different features.

original_source.creator: Dr. William H. Wolberg (University of Wisconsin)
original_source.publication: O. L. Mangasarian and W. H. Wolberg: Cancer diagnosis via linear programming
